page.title: 18Recreation Newton/Linton.
page.content: Newton-on-Ouse has a very good playing field where football and cricket matches are played.Team members are drawn from Linton-on-Ouse, Newton-on-Ouse and the surrounding area.Children's recreational equipment is sited on the Playing Field and on several playing spaces on the housing areas of R.A.F. Linton-on-Ouse. Fishing is very popular on the River Ouse and the Kyle,which flows into the Ouse.Barbel,roach,dace,trout,perch,eel and pike are caught.Salmon travel up the river to spawn.Fishing rites are privately owned and tickets are needed to fish these waters. People from the two villages meet in Newton Parish Hall to play bowls. Every house has its own garden,with flower beds,vegetable plots and lawns; the whirr of the lawn mower is a familiar sound on summer evenings.
